attributes.action: UK spouse visa should increase in line with  National minimum wage £25,000.
attributes.additional_details: We urge the government not only to reconsider this proposal but also review its approach towards migration policies that affect innocent citizens who simply wish to build their lives with their loved ones here in Britain. The UK Spouse visa should not exceed £25,000 threshold for people  working on national minimum wage.
attributes.background:
£29,000 is still too high.Not even people on good job meet requirements. Ironically even some home office job don't meet £38,700.


According to Migration Observatory at Oxford University 2017 approximately 40% of workers do not earn enough to sponsor a spouse's visa under existing rules.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/653641
